title.narrative: Embedding and scaling tools for integrated water management in Colombia

description.narrative: In times of drought and water scarcity, water operators are expected to manage the water resources effectively and efficiently, meeting the demands of all users. This is no small task, especially as demands increase, as the variability of hydrologic and hydraulic pro-cesses become more pronounced, and as stakeholder expectations of system performance increase in complexity. Colombia is no exception and is facing major challenges in relation to water resources management.HERMANA (HERramienta para el MANejo del Agua) is an online web-based tool for integrated water management in Colombia. The system combines real-time meteorological, hydrological, hydrogeological, water quality data and satellite monitoring data. It gives the possibility to run hydrological forecasts in FEWS and calculate drought indices via InfoSequia. Via the HydroNET Portal situational reports, warnings and dashboards are generated tailored to the need of the clients and stakeholders.The HERMANA-project has led to the development and embedding of an integrated water management tool and decision support system (including the necessary governance arrangements) for the regional water authority in Valle del Cauca (CVC), Colombia. This project was developed through a partnership between Deltares, Hydrologic, Future Water and the Dutch Water Authorities. The parties have successfully delivered the project, which will be finalised in November 2019. The Government of the Netherlands, through the Partners for Water programme, focuses on the development and scaling of activities of the Dutch water sector in Colombia. The successful example of HERMANA in Valle del Cauca has the potential to be scaled to other regional water authorities. This was underlined during a meeting of ASOCARS, the central organisation or regional water authorities, in September 2019. Besides that, the continuous activities of the Dutch Water Authorities, through the Blue Deal programme InspirAgua, also provides a basis to work on the scaling of the initiative. The development of four-year plans of the regional water authorities is an opportunity to embed the need for (Dutch) integrated water management tools and decision support systems. This project is conducted in cooperation with: Future Water, Deltares, Dutch Water Authorities and Corporacion Autonoma Valle del Cauca.
